concept.title: Outbound Restriction Overview
concept.shortdesc: Outbound Restriction is used to limit how many outbound calls extension users can make within specified time period.

section.title: Scenarios
section.p: Most toll fraud is committed from the outside. Hackers may attack the system by registering to extensions and making outbound calls frequently.
With the Outbound Restriction rules, if extension users make outbound calls over the limited frequency, the extensions will be blocked and unable to make outbound calls.

section.title: Default outbound restriction rule
section.p: The PBX has a default rule to limit users to make maximum 5 outbound calls in 1 minute. You can add another Outbound Restriction rule according to your needs.

p.note: We recommend that you keep the default Outbound Restriction rule.

section.title: Cancel restriction of outbound calls
section.p: If a user makes outbound calls over the limit, the extension will be locked and prohibited from making outbound calls. On Extensions list, the extension status will display .
Double click the icon , the extension will be able to make outbound calls again.
